bug.author: marwanfahmi
bug.summary: MiniKF dashboard external IP address not connecting
bug.description: Hi, I have a MiniKF deployment on GCP and the VM instance is up and running with both HTTP and HTTPS traffic allowed in the VM settings, however, when I navigate to the external IP address to access the Kubeflow dashboard I get Unable to connect message. What could possibly cause this? Many Thanks,

comments.comment:
Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the labels:
Label Probability
kind/bug 0.60
Please mark this comment with or to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-botdata/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marwanfahmi>@marwanfahmi</denchmark-link> ! When the MiniKF VM gets provisioned, it needs some time for everything to come up. Until then, you get the error you described. Please check out the instructions about MiniKF on GCP in the kubeflow docs: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/workstation/minikf-gcp/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/workstation/minikf-gcp/</denchmark-link>
You will see how to SSH into the VM and follow the on-screen instructions. Can you confirm if this solves you issue?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> - This to confirm that this resolved my issue. I got confused because I was able to ssh the machine but not access the UI. Thanks a lot!
